section_overview: Quick, low-stress things to do around World Equestrian Center–Ocala during the winter circuit. Everything here is realistic between trips to stabling, the warm-up ring, and the jog strip—easy parking, short drives, and options that won’t derail your show schedule.
section_cta_text: Bookmark for off-days and late-afternoon resets—share with grooms and barn managers.

leisure.name: Silver Springs State Park (Glass-Bottom Boats)
leisure.when_to_go: Morning or non-peak afternoons between classes
leisure.why: Laid-back springs cruise to loosen up legs after a long horse show day.
leisure.booking: Walk-up often OK; weekends/holidays book online in advance.
leisure.insider_tips: Bring a light jacket; parking is easy. Back at WEC before vendor row closes.

leisure.name: Sholom Park
leisure.when_to_go: Quiet morning stretch or sunset stroll
leisure.why: Peaceful gardens and paved loops—perfect mental reset before the jog.
leisure.insider_tips: Flat paths; easy footwear. Keep it short if you’re on standby for ring calls.

leisure.name: Downtown Ocala Square Coffee Walk
leisure.why: Grab a quick coffee/pastry and stretch your legs around the Square.
leisure.booking: No booking—street parking or garages nearby.
leisure.insider_tips: Easy in/out; aim off-peak to avoid dinner traffic.

culture.name: Appleton Museum of Art
culture.why: Compact, high-quality galleries—culture hit without losing a half-day.
culture.booking: General admission at door; check hours in winter.
culture.insider_tips: Budget 60–90 minutes; back to stabling before PM classes.

culture.name: Reilly Arts Center
culture.when_to_go: Evening between weeks or light show nights
culture.why: Concerts and events in a rider-friendly timeframe.
culture.booking: Buy tickets online; shows can sell out.
culture.insider_tips: Plan parking and be wheels-up early if you’re first in the order next morning.

culture.name: Fort King National Historic Landmark
culture.why: Short trails and history fix without a full day commitment.
culture.booking: No reservations needed; check gate hours.
culture.insider_tips: Good for kids and visiting family; dirt paths—bring sneakers.

family_active.name: Canyons Zip Line & Adventure Park
family_active.why: High-energy zip lines over canyons and lakes—kid favorite.
family_active.insider_tips: Plan 2–3 hours door-to-door; not ideal the evening before your Grand Prix.

family_active.name: Santos Trailhead (Florida Greenway) — Bike & Hike
family_active.why: MTB singletrack and multi-use paths for all levels.
family_active.booking: No booking; rentals available nearby (check ahead).
family_active.insider_tips: Stick to easy loops if you’re riding later—save legs for the ring.

family_active.name: Silver Springs Boardwalk & Springside Trails
family_active.why: Wildlife spotting on shaded boardwalks; stroller-friendly.
family_active.insider_tips: Great for non-horse show family; keep an eye on time if you’re on the order.

attractions.name: Rainbow Springs State Park (Headsprings & Gardens)
attractions.why: Iconic clear-water spring with short garden trails.
attractions.booking: Capacity limits on peak days—arrive early.
attractions.insider_tips: Very time-efficient if you park at the headsprings lot.

attractions.name: Devil’s Den Prehistoric Spring
attractions.insider_tips: Account for gear check-in/out; not a quick turn if you’re first in the order next day.

attractions.name: Gypsy Gold Horse Farm Tour
attractions.why: Ocala horse-country history and up-close with Gypsy Vanners.
attractions.insider_tips: Easy parking; great for visiting family between your trips to stabling.

attractions.name: WEC Saturday Night Grand Prix (On-Site)
attractions.why: Atmosphere, vendors, and big-class energy under the lights.
attractions.booking: Check WEC schedule; arrive early for seating.
attractions.insider_tips: Layer up for cool nights; plan cart charging before heading to the ring.
